definition: brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
eyebrow/upper margin

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Mary grinned at her boyfriend the moment she saw him.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗一看到男友就對他眉開眼笑起來。

sentences.english: After hearing the results of his exam he walked around campus with a smile from ear to ear.
sentences.chinese: 聽到他的考試成績後，他眉開眼笑地在校園裏漫步。

sentences.english: Linda held up two fingers andbeamed.
sentences.chinese: 琳達眉開眼笑地對我舉起兩根手指。

sentences.english: He looked happy as if hearing Auspicious Dragon Chant.
sentences.chinese: 他高興得眉開眼笑，彷彿見到祥龍詠唱。

sentences.english: He replaced the receiver, beaming from ear to ear, whistling a happy tune.
sentences.chinese: 他放下話筒，眉開眼笑，用口哨吹著一首快樂的曲子。

sentences.english: I pause. Wes beams up at me.
sentences.chinese: 我停下，維斯眉開眼笑地望着我。

sentences.english: A wonderful joy had transfigured this old man.
sentences.chinese: 一陣眉開眼笑的喜色好象改變了老人的容貌。

definition: to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to upbraid
to mediate/to broker a compromise
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
furious/enraged
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
sullen/to scowl miserably
happily/giddily
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
to strut/swaggering
